metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5800 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An off-by-one error within the "LibRaw::kodak_ycbcr_load_raw()" function (internal/dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.7 can be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow and subsequently cause a crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.8-1
libraw19 - 0.18.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: darktable package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.8-1').
rawtherapee package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
